meanings.definition: A long, hooded cloak or robe worn in North Africa.
meanings.sent1: The merchant wore a colorful burnooses to protect himself from the desert sun.
meanings.sent2: In the market, you could see many burnooses of different colors and patterns.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor comically tripped over his own burnooses, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: The burnooses of tradition wrapped around her like a shield, preserving her heritage.
meanings.sent5: The image of the burnooses billowing in the wind stayed etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: The plural form of burnoose, referring to multiple long, hooded cloaks or robes worn in North Africa.
meanings.sent1: At the festival, a group of dancers twirled in their vibrant burnooses.
meanings.sent2: The travelers admired the intricate designs of the burnooses displayed in the shop.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they played dress-up, each wearing colorful burnooses.
meanings.sent4: The burnooses fluttered like colorful birds in the bustling marketplace.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the burnooses hanging on the line created a picturesque scene.
